title: Binary Search
prompt:
Given a sorted array of integers nums and a target integer, return the index of target if it exists, otherwise return -1.

The array is sorted in ascending order.
constraintQuestions: Is the array sorted in ascending order? (Yes.)
What should we return if the target is not found? (-1.)
Do we need O(log n) time? (Yes.)

walkthrough.title: Binary search idea
walkthrough.body:
Keep two pointers, left and right, that define the current search space.
Compute mid = floor((left + right) / 2).
If nums[mid] equals target, return mid.
If nums[mid] is less than target, move left to mid + 1.
If nums[mid] is greater than target, move right to mid - 1.
If the search space collapses, return -1.

walkthrough.title: JavaScript (iterative implementation)
Complexity
walkthrough.body:
Time: O(log n) because the search space halves each step.
Space: O(1).
